sn9.12:1: On one occasion a certain bhikkhu was dwelling among the Kosalans in a certain woodland thicket. Then the devata that inhabited that woodland thicket approached that bhikkhu and recited this verse in his presence:
sn9.12:2: v.789"When the noon hour sets inAnd the birds have settled down,The mighty forest itself murmurs:How fearful that appears to me!"
sn9.12:3: v.790"When the noon hour sets inAnd the birds have settled down,The mighty forest itself murmurs:How delightful that appears to me!"
